      • loadRequested

        public void loadRequested()
        Description copied from interface: ServicesToPreloadI
        Implementers don't actually have to do anything when called here... they can do the init in the constructor if the prefer. This is just to prevent the compiler from doing something silly and dropping the for-loop over the ServiceToPreloadI objects, when it looks like nothing is actually being done. Implementors may do something here, however, if they prefer to have the constructor do nothing, and instead, handle the loading when loadRequested is called. This will be called during the startup sequence, after the database init has completed. If any expensive works needs to be done as a result of loadRequested - it should be done in a background thread - loadRequested should return immediately.
        Specified by:
        loadRequested in interface ServicesToPreloadI
        See Also:
        ServicesToPreloadI.loadRequested()

      • shutdown

        public void shutdown()
        Description copied from interface: ServicesToPreloadI

        Specified by:

        See Also:

      • createNewUser

        public User createNewUser(User user)
                   throws InvalidUserException,
                          IOException
        A convenience method for GUI use which will create an entirely new user, which wasn't declared as part of the initial users set. Only callable by users with admin permissions. This method will fail with an exception if either the User.getUniqueFullName() or the User.getUniqueLogonName() are in fact, not unique.
        Throws:
        InvalidUserException
        IOException

      • registerLoginCallback

        public void registerLoginCallback(Consumer<String> userLoggedIn)

      • configureAutomationMode

        public void configureAutomationMode(File userProfileLocation)
                             throws InvalidUserException
        This can be called to set the "logged in" user to the 'user' user - having appropriate values for the various calls here. This is typically used for operations like mojo execution during a DB build, or JUnit testing. This cannot be called if authenticate(String, String) has been called. Calling loadRequested() after calling this is a noop - it will not load users in the normal way. When Automation Mode is configured - any API call that makes changes will throw an exception. create*, save*, etc.
        Parameters:
        userProfileLocation - (optional) the path to use for the user profiles. Defaults to 'profiles' relative to the JVM launch path. If the location is provided, it will also look there for any existing users, and populate the real users list. If null, it won't attempt to load users.
        Throws:
        InvalidUserException

      • isAutomationModeEnabled

        public boolean isAutomationModeEnabled()
